==Japanese==

===Etymology 1===
<div style="float:right;">
{{wikipedia|lang=ja}}
[[File:Sendai_Tanabata_2005.jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|七夕}}: Tanabata in Sendai, 2005]]
{{wikipedia|Tanabata}}
</div>
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=irr|sort=たなばた}}
Origins somewhat obscure.

The latter ''bata'' portion is generally accepted to be from {{m|ja|機|tr=hata||a [[loom]]}}. The ''hata'' changes to ''bata'' due to {{rendaku|たなばた}}.

The former ''tana'' portion may be from {{m|ja|棚|tr=tana||a shelf, or a board placed lengthwise in a bridge}}, in reference to an ancient ritual whereby a maiden would weave a special cloth on a ''hata'' in order to secure a bountiful harvest, as an offering for a god coming across a body of water via a ''tana''. A related theory states that ''tana'' is instead an alteration of {{m|ja|種|tr=tane||seed}}. Yet another theory states that ''tana'' is an alteration of {{m|ja|手|tr=ta||hand|pos=unbound {{etyl|ojp|-}} form}} + {{m|ja|な|tr=na|pos={{etyl|ojp|-}} possessive particle superseded by ''[[の#Japanese|no]]''}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

The common spelling of {{l|ja|七夕}} is an example of [[熟字訓#Japanese|jukujikun]], since the festival is held on the seventh night of the seventh month of the [[lunar calendar]], now generally observed on 7 July.

* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|訓読み|Kun'yomi}} {{qualifier|irregular}}

* {{IPA|lang=ja|[ta̠na̠ba̠ta̠]}}
